meanings.definition: Providing comfort or solace to someone who is experiencing sadness or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: The consoling hug from his friend made him feel better.
meanings.sent2: She offered consoling words to her upset sister.
meanings.sent3: The consoling puppy tried to cheer up its sad owner.
meanings.sent4: The consoling presence of the sunset eased her troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: The consoling melody of the music brought peace to her heart.

meanings.definition: Serving to alleviate grief or sorrow.
meanings.sent1: The consoling gesture of a warm cup of tea was appreciated.
meanings.sent2: His consoling smile brightened her day.
meanings.sent3: The consoling rain seemed to wash away her worries.
meanings.sent4: The consoling touch of a friend's hand lessened her pain.
meanings.sent5: The consoling colors of the painting lifted her spirits.

meanings.definition: Offering sympathy or support to someone in distress.
meanings.sent1: Her consoling presence was a source of strength for him.
meanings.sent2: He gave her a consoling pat on the back.
meanings.sent3: The consoling note left on her desk made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The consoling advice helped her through a tough time.
meanings.sent5: The consoling act of kindness warmed her heart.
